main event: A UFO sighting occurred on 6 December 1957 in Argyle, Iowa. The object circled, started as a dim light, grew extremely bright, and then faded from sight over a 15-minute observation period.
interesting points: The UFO sighting was observed for a duration of 15 minutes through binoculars.
The object was described as circular and initially appeared as a dim light before becoming extremely bright.
No sound was reported during the sighting.
The report suggests that no photographs were taken as there is no mention of them in the document.
The conclusion of the report lists possible explanations such as balloon, aircraft, and astronomical phenomena, but ultimately categorizes the sighting as unknown.
sighted object: circular object that started as a dim light and grew extremely bright before fading from sight
